content.p:
Suppose we wish to maximize f(x_1, x_2, x_3, x_4) = {{objectivefunction}} subject to:
\begin{array}{rcl} {{row1}} & \leq & {{b1}} \\ {{row2}} & \leq & {{b2}} \\ {{row3}} & \leq & {{b3}} \\ {{row4}} & = & {{b4}} \\ x_1, x_2, x_3 & \geq & 0. \end{array}
State the dual problem, encode both noncanonical problems in a tableau and use pivots to convert the dual problem into a canonical dual problem and solve it.

outtro.p:
The dual problem is minimize g(y_1, y_2, y_3, y_4) = {{dualfunction}} subject to:
\begin{array}{rcl} {{drow1}} & \geq & {{c1}} \\ {{drow2}} & \geq & {{c2}} \\ {{drow3}} & \geq & {{c3}} \\ {{drow4}} & = & {{c4}} \\ y_1, y_2, y_3 & \geq & 0. \end{array}
